Unlocking Blocks
================

A little-known fact about cows is that they love puzzles! For Bessie's<br>birthday, Farmer John gives her an interesting mechanical puzzle for her to<br>solve.  The puzzle consists of three solid objects, each of which is built<br>from 1x1 unit squares glued together.  Each of these objects is a<br>"connected" shape,  in the sense that you can get from one square on the<br>object to any other square on the object by stepping north, south, east, or<br>west, through squares on the object.<br><br>An object can be moved by repeatedly sliding it either north, south,<br>east, or west one unit.  The goal of the puzzle is to move the objects<br>so that they are separated -- where their bounding boxes no longer<br>share any positive overlap with each-other.  Given the shapes and<br>locations of the three objects, your task is to help Bessie decide<br>what is the minimum number of individual slides required to separate<br>the objects.

<img src="data:image/png;base64," alt="">

PROBLEM NAME: unlock<br><br>INPUT FORMAT:<br><br>* Line 1: Three space-separated integers: N1, N2, and N3, describing<br>        respectively the number of unit squares making up objects 1,<br>        2, and 3.<br><br>* Lines 2..1+N1: Each of these lines describes the (x,y) location of<br>        the south-west corner of single square that is part of object<br>        1.  All coordinates lie in the range 0..9.<br><br>* Lines 2+N1..1+N1+N2: Each of these lines describes the (x,y)<br>        location of the south-west corner of single square that is<br>        part of object 2.  All coordinates lie in the range 0..9.<br><br>* Lines 2+N1+N2..1+N1+N2+N3: Each of these lines describes the (x,y)<br>        location of the south-west corner of single square that is<br>        part of object 3.  All coordinates lie in the range 0..9.<br><br>SAMPLE INPUT:<br><br>12 3 5<br>0 0<br>1 0<br>2 0<br>3 0<br>3 1<br>0 1<br>0 2<br>0 3<br>0 4<br>1 4<br>2 4<br>3 4<br>2 1<br>2 2<br>1 2<br>2 3<br>3 3<br>4 3<br>4 4<br>4 2<br><br>INPUT DETAILS:<br><br>Object 1 is made from 12 squares, object 2 is made from 3 squares, and<br>object 3 is made from 5 squares.  The shapes of the objects are those in<br>the figure above.<br><br>OUTPUT FORMAT:<br><br>* Line 1: The minimum number of moves necessary to separate the three<br>objects, or -1 if the objects cannot be separated.<br><br>SAMPLE OUTPUT:<br><br>5<br><br>OUTPUT DETAILS:<br><br>If we slide object 3 to the east by one position, then slide object 2<br>north by one position, then slide object 1 west by three positions,<br>then the bounding boxes of the three objects will no longer share any<br>overlap in common.
